body_html:
Yes, this would be a feature request, although I'm not sure how useful/needed it really is.

In the mean-time I switched to tf.train.SingularMonitoredSession instead, as it allows me to access the raw session object to reinitialise the iterator and evaluate the model every n epochs without any hooks beeing called. Since I don't have a distributed setting this solves my problem.

If there is no need for it in distributes settings, fell free to close the issue.

body:
Yes, this would be a feature request, although I'm not sure how useful/needed it really is.

In the mean-time I switched to ```tf.train.SingularMonitoredSession``` instead, as it allows me to access the raw session object to reinitialise the iterator and evaluate the model every n epochs without any hooks beeing called. Since I don't have a distributed setting this solves my problem.

If there is no need for it in distributes settings, fell free to close the issue.
